author: Jazz Monroe

title: The Cure, Laura Marling, and More: This Week’s Pitchfork Selects Playlist
description: Our weekly playlist highlights songs that our writers, editors, and contributors are listening to on repeat
author: Pitchfork

title: Achim Szepanski, Founder of Influential Electronic Labels Mille Plateaux and Force Inc., Dies at 67
description: Szepanski released landmark ambient albums by the likes of Gas and Oval while maintaining principles drawn from his work as a philosopher
author: Jazz Monroe

title: Oasis Add North American Dates to 2025 Reunion Tour
description: In addition to their UK leg, the Gallagher brothers will bring their long-awaited comeback concerts to Canada, the United States, and Mexico
author: Nina Corcoran

title: Kris Kristofferson, Outlaw Country Singer and Hollywood Star, Dies at 88
description: Kristofferson was known for “Me and Bobby McGee,” “Help Me Make It Through the Night,” his starring role in A Star Is Born, and more
author: Madison Bloom, Matthew Strauss

title: Watch Jelly Roll Perform on Saturday Night Live’s 50th Season Premiere
description: The Tennessee country artist sang “Liar” and “Winning Streak”
author: Matthew Strauss

title: Bright Eyes Cancel 2024 Tour Dates as Conor Oberst Requires Treatment for “Vocal Problems”
description: The band had been due to play concerts in September, October, and November in support of new album Five Dice, All Threes
author: Matthew Strauss

title: Action Bronson Joins Bad Bunny in Cast of New Darren Aronofsky Movie
description: The musicians star alongside Austin Butler, Zoë Kravitz, and others in Caught Stealing
author: Matthew Strauss
